result.execSummary:
The defendant Jajuan L Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample if not previously done so- pay surcharge. Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs. The Court ordered all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

02-11-16/ Judge Frederick C Rosa
The Court ordered the JOC shall be amended to include a TOTAL of 196 days of sentence credit on count one.
*10/12/2018  Amended to include a total of 207 days of sentence credit.
*3/7/2019  Sentence credit amended to  210 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other time sentence. With credit for 210  days.

Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. mag
Revocation Order and Warrant in case 10CF002025 dated 8/10/15.
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
Original Transcript (23 pages) commencing 10/14/2015 PLEA AND SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant Jajuan L Powell in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  
Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury trial.  Defense no longer in contest posture.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. 

COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion the Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Count 1.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by state, defense and defendant. 
 
COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 1/2 YEARS, CONCURRENT with any other time sentence with credit for 0 days. 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS.  
The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 2 YEARS.

The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

*Provide DNA sample if not previously done so- pay surcharge;
*Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs;

The Court ordered all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.  Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms.  Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.  Defendant advised of right to appeal this sentence. 
Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence-copy to defendant.

Defendant Jajuan L Powell in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Jajuan L Powell in custody.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for preliminary hearing. State filed an Amended Criminal Complaint.   Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF1327 that are attached to the amended complaint. All charges on the amended complaint remain the same as the original complaint.   Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Boehlke.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 7.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jajuan L Powell in court with Student Intern Gillion Parham under the supervision of attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Jajuan L Powell in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
